name: Overview
main:
Libya is divided between three governments, each relying on local militias for territorial control. The country has been in a state of civil war since 2014, generating shortages of food, fuel, water, medical supplies and electricity, as well as reduced access to healthcare and public services. 

Health, protection, shelter and NFIs are main reported needs, for both displaced and host populations. 

INFORM measures Libya's risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster to be high, at 6.1/10. Hazard and exposure as well as lack of coping capacity are of particular concern, at 8.4/10 and 6.9/10 respectively.?
latest_developments_past: 28/10: Members of ISIL attacked a police station located in Al-Fuqaha, Jufra region, killing four people, including two who were public executed. At least nine people were kidnapped.?
